series.title: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
series.author: Preston Pysh and Stig Brodersen | Investing Podcast, Business Podcast, Money Podcast, Entrepreneur Podcast, Stock Trading, Stock Market, Stock Investing

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP128: Edward Thorp - Investing Legend, Math Genius (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig talk to renown author, mathematician, and investor, Dr. Edward Thorp.  Thorp's personal net worth is $800M, and he has achieved a 20% annual return for 30 years in the stock market.  Before becoming one of the best hedge fund managers on the planet, Dr. Thorp literally wrote the book on card-counting for blackjack.  The name of the book was, Beat the Dealer, and the techniques taught in the book went on the create an entire culture around card counting in Casinos.  You won't want to miss this conversation as the hosts uncover some fascinating ideas from one of the smartest mathematical minds on the planet.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 127 : Living In Space and What's Next w/ NASA Astronaut Tim Kopra
episodes.summary: In this episode, you’ll learn:  What it's like to get shot into space What it's like to live in the International Space Station What it's like to re-enter the earth's atmosphere Why billionaire Elon Musk thought it was easier to start up a space company than making the cut to become an astronaut at NASA How it literally feels to walk around in space and why it’s very different from what you see in the movies. Why big goals are empowering and how to model your behavior to achieve them. Which impact billionaires Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos have had on the space industry and if we’ll ever colonize Mars.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 126 : The Third Wave - A Review of Billionaire Steve Case's Book (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, you'll learn:  Why the story of AOL is really a story about the Internet. How to negotiate with Microsoft when Bill Gates really wants to crush you. Why and how the Internet will be enabled in all devices in the future. Why the biggest merger in the field of technology failed and what we can learn from it.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 125 : Billionaire Reid Hoffman & The Start-Up of You (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, you'll learn: • How to build a professional network, so you don’t have to apply for a job the traditional way. • How you develop a competitive advantage as an employee in today’s market • How to take intelligent risks in your business and on your job. • Ask the investors: What are the biggest biases new investors have?

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 124 : One Up On Wall Street by Peter Lynch (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, you'll learn:  If new investors should build their portfolio around small cap stocks. Why there is more to it than just picking companies you understand How to identify a stock pick that has pricing power. A rather untraditional approach to identifying good stocks. Ask The Investors: Should a value investor invest in net-net stocks?

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 123 : Part 2 Momentum Investing w/ Dr. Wesley Gray (Finance Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode you will learn:  Why value investors have the perfect temperament to follow a momentum strategy. If investors can improve their momentum strategy by individual stock picking. Why Dr. Gray is long US stocks though he believes they are highly overvalued. Ask the Investors: Why and when you should consider shorting the S&P500. Ask the Investors: What moment did you decided to become a lifelong learner?

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 122 : Momentum Investing w/ Dr. Wesley Gray (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, you'll learn:  Why momentum investing is not the same as growth investing Why value investor should consider a momentum strategy in their portfolio Why investing is like poker, where the best players win over time Ask the investors: What do you look for in a 10K?

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 121 : Super-Investor Mohnish Pabrai - Part 2 (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, you'll learn:  Why Mohnish Pabrai recently invested in Southwest Airlines. What Mohnish Pabrai’s biggest investment mistake is, and how he later made more than $100 million because of it. If Warren Buffett and Charlie Munger consider any macro decisions in their investment approach. Why the airline industry is a terrible sector, but might still be a great investment at the moment.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 120 : Warren Buffett's Clone: Mohnish Pabrai - Part I (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, you'll learn:  How Mohnish accumulated business knowledge from the age of 11 Why Mohnish is one of the very best and respected investors in the value investing community What special advantages people like Bill Gates and Warren Buffett had to become so successful How Mohnish set up and ran a business like Warren Buffett and Charlie Munger Why investing is not a team sport

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 119 : The Lean Startup by Eric Ries (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, you'll learn:  How to use Six sigma to optimize your processes. How to use Validated Learning to develop what the customer truly wants. What Innovation Accounting is and why every start-up should use it. How to develop a minimum viable product, and push it out as soon as possible. Why you should always ask “Why” 5 times when your company faces a problem.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 118 : Mastermind Discussion 4th Quarter (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, the mastermind members discuss the following topics:  Why Berkshire Hathaway is building a small equity position in the airline industry. Why gold might be a good asset class depending on the country you live in. What has caused the sell-off in bonds and how that will influence the stock market. Why India recently took the biggest currency bills out of circulation overnight.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 117 : Value Investing Legend, Bill Miller (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, we interview one of the best investors of all time, Bill Miller.  We discuss the following topics:  Why Bill thinks some value investors miscalculate the value of Amazon. Why billionaire macro investors think that bond yields might go to 6% in 12-18 months. If the Enterprise Multiple is the best key ratio to filter stocks by. Why Bill thinks Apple was a bad capital allocator and how they have improved. How Bill views the value of Tesla at the end of 2016.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 116 : The 35 Year Bond Bubble w/ Grant Williams (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode we study: - Ray Dalio's thoughts on whether the Bond Market has ended it's Bull Streak  - Why Cash might be a great call option on all asset classes - Thoughts on the current conditions of Gold - What an economic reset is and how it applies to today's market - Why the dollar is the primary reserve currency on borrowed time

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 115 : Value Investing and Special Situations w/ Toby Carlisle (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, you'll learn:  If the presidential election will have any impact on the stock market. An alternative approach to invest in an overvalued market. How to use options as a value investor. How Warren Buffett used a special investing strategy to achieve 29.5% over a 12 years period Ask the investor: How to start your career as a value investor

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 114 : Part II - Jim Rickards ~ The Road to Ruin (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode you will learn about:  The history of how the FED makes interest rates decision  Where the FED is making mistakes by ignoring credit growth What the FED will do in DEC 2016 World taxation and how it could happen What Ben Bernanke and William Dudley personally told Jim about raising rates

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 113 : Jim Rickards and the Road to Ruin (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, you'll learn:  Why we faced a crisis in 1998 and 2008, and why me might have an even bigger crisis in 2018. That the FED is leveraged 113-1, and why the IMF will be bailing out the FED during the next crisis. What “SDR money ” is and why it will become the new global currency anyone noticing it. Why the conventional economic models are wrong, and which type of science should be used to replace it.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 112 : Billionaire Paul Allen - Idea Man (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, you'll learn:  How Bill Gates and Paul Allen founded Microsoft and why it couldn’t have happened without their complimentary skill sets. Why Bill Gates and Paul Allen had all the right external factors on their side to become billionaires. What you might do when you retire at age 30 and have more than a billion dollars. If Microsoft has the right business strategy for the future.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 111 : Good to Great - (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, you'll learn:  Why the best company leaders consider themselves lucky rather than skilled, and why you should do the same. How to find the right people for your organization by asking “why” multiple times. Why and when it pays to be a pessimist in life and in business. Why the great companies would rather use technology as an accelerator, but never as a creator for their concepts. Why success always looks to be happening overnight, but in reality is always a question of consistency.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 110 : Jesse Felder and the Current Market Conditions
episodes.summary: In this episode, you'll learn:  Why margin debt might be a good indicator for future stock returns Why cash and real assets like gold are the least risk right now How Preston’s junk bond position has performed Which monetary policy Janet Yellen should execute Why Minsky’s theory is important for volatility trading Ask the Investors: How do I value goodwill?

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 109 : Questions from the Audience (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, you will learn about the following ideas:  If Warren Buffet can achieve a 50% return on $1 Million dollars The importance of catalysts in value investing Preston and Stig’s thoughts on home ownerships and REITs as investments If you should invest in foreign bonds

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 108 : The Outsiders - 8 CEOs w/ Huge Returns (Investing podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, we read William Thorndike's book, The Outsiders.  The book talks about eight CEOs that had radically high returns and how they achieved such results. This episode covers the following topics.   Why you want the CEO to think more like a capital allocator than a traditional CEO How the best capital allocators create arbitrage on their own stocks How to use debt intelligently when growing your company How and why the most profitable companies do not compete on price

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 107 : Jack Welch's book - Winning (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, you will learn about the following ideas.  How to rise to the top of the corporate world Why you should openly rank your employees and reward them accordingly How to provide feedback for your boss The one question you should ask to identify the best candidate for a job Why you should implement Lean Six Sigma Ask the investors: How much money do I need to start investing

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP106 : Influence and Pre-Suasion w/ Dr. Robert Cialdini (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig interview the legendary Dr. Robert Cialdini.  Dr. Cialdini is a New York Times Best Selling Author and is one of the leading researchers in the world for psychology and influence.  In the interview, Dr. Cialdini talks about some of the new ideas found in his new book titled, Pre-Suasion.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 105 : Mastermind Group 2016 3rd Quarter (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode the Mastermind Group discusses various topics during the 3rd quarter 2016.  Below are some of the ideas the group talks about.  How can the investor find a decent yield when so many asset classes are overvalued? Why special situations might provide the best investing approach right now If Humana is a profitable risk arbitrage investment right now How you can generate a steady cash flow by selling put options in great businesses If dollar cost averaging is a good investment strategy in the current market conditions If QE causes a roaring stock market

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 104 : Billionaire Carl Icahn - A Rare Look Behind the Scenes w/ Mark Stevens, author of King Icahn (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: One of the most misunderstood celebrity investors in the world is Billionaire Carl Icahn. Luckily for our audience, our guest Mark Stevens was one of the few people to forge a relationship with the unique and un-empathetic investor. In this episode you'll learn about: -What “greenmail” is and how Icahn basically got paid for not taking over companies -How to conduct an activist approach to investing -Why Carl Icahn always wins in a negotiation -If Carl Icahn is truly a bear in the current market conditions

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 103 : Life Inc. - Running your home finances like a business w/ Doug McCormick
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig talk to private equity expert, Doug McCormick, about using business principals to invest your family income.  Doug provides some unique ways to think about spending one's time and treating it like an asset.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 102 : Common Stocks & Uncommon Profits - A Discussion of Philip Fisher's Classic Book (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: Billionaire Warren Buffett said his investing approach is 85% Graham and 15% Fisher. Because of this quote, Preston and Stig read Philip Fisher's famous book, Common Stocks and Uncommon Profits.  The book provides an interesting background on qualitative investing.  Fisher's style is geared towards teaching the reader how to look for growth companies that promise expansion in their respective markets.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 101 : Creativity Inc - by Pixar's Ed Catmull (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig read the book, Creativity Inc., by Ed Catmull.  This was a fantastic book for anyone wanting to learn how to be more creative.  Additionally, the book goes into great detail describing the important aspects of designing a business that will have an enduring competitive advantage.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 100 : Cold-Calling Our Audience and what we Learned Studying Billionaires for 100 Shows (Investment Podcast)
episodes.summary: In Preston and Stig's 100th episode of The Investor's Podcast, they celebrate by cold calling a few members of their audience.  The members of the community can ask any question they want in an unscripted and open format.  Additionally, Preston and Stig talk about what their key take-aways were after studying billionaires and the market for 100 shows.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 099 : Billionaire Jack Ma and Alibaba (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig learn about the Chinese billionaire Jack Ma.  Jack is the founder of the internet company, Alibaba, which is the biggest internet company in Asia.  His company has over 407 million users and quickly growing.  Within the next five years, Alibaba may ship more packages per day than all the daily mail in the United States.  Preston and Stig learn about Jack by reading Duncan Clark's new book, Alibaba.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 098 : The Power of Habit by Charles Duhigg (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: View the Show Notes for this episode    Read reviews of, The Power of Habit, on Amazon   In this episode, Preston and Stig talk about the New York Times best selling book, The Power of Habit, by Charles Duhigg.  The book is an amazing opportunity to learn about your personal habits and how powerful they are at controlling your daily life.  Once an individual recognizes which habits they want to reform, Charlies provides methods for re-programming your life.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 097 : China and the History of the Dollar (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Mr. Richard Duncan provides a detailed lesson about the history of the US dollar and the American trade deficit.  As the episode progresses, the listener will learn how the US defaulted on the Bretton Woods agreement in 1971 and how that drastically impacted the difficult situations we face today.  Click here to view the  Show Notes   Links to Richard's books: The New Depression – Read reviews of this book  The Dollar Crisis – Read reviews of this book

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 096 : Billionaire Phil Knight & Nike - Shoe Dog (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig talk about Billionaire Phil Knight and how he founded Nike.  They use the book, Shoe Dog, to gather a first-hand account of Phil's journey at starting the business.  You will learn about the struggles and difficulties of starting a brand and a new business.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 095 : Billionaire Tony Hsieh's Book - Delivering Happiness at Zappos (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig talk about the most recent book they read, Delivering Happiness.  This book was written by billionaire Tony Hsieh and it was one of the best books that Preston and Stig read in 2016.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 094 : Raoul Pal - Macro Economics and Global Risks (Investment Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig talk to one of the most notable macro investors in the world, Raoul Pal.  Raoul is the owner and CEO of Real Vision TV and he has interviewed some of the biggest names in finance.  During this interview, Raoul talks about some of the biggest ideas he has heard from billionaire hedge fund managers and high net worth individuals.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 093 : BREXIT - The Financial Impact (Investment Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig have a mastermind discussion about BREXIT with two close friends that live in the UK and Germany.  The discussion centers around the potential of other countries leaving the EU and central banking.  The group discusses the potential risks of more exits from the EU along with thoughts of other famous billionaires on the issue.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 092 : Billionaire Lives w/ Navy SEAL for 30 Days - feat. Atlanta Hawks Owner, Jesse Itzler
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig interview the billionaire owner of the Atlanta Hawks, Jesse Itzler.  Jesse discusses his experience of living with one of the most extreme athletes in the entire world for 30 days.  Additionally, Jesse talks about being successful in business and his sale of Marquis Jet to Warren Buffett.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 091 : Mastermind Group 2Q 2016 (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, Preston and Stig join the members of their mastermind group to discuss a few hot topics.  The topics discussed are the following: The Value of Apple The Value of Amazon Mohnish Pabrai's new ETF How to look at share buy backs

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 090 : Jesse Felder's Macro & Micro Views on the Market (Stock Investing)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig talk to billion dollar hedge fund manager, Jesse Felder.  Jesse talks about the investing approach of a couple billionaires and he identifies some of the biggest risks to the current global economy.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 089 : Oil - A Bearish Opinion (Investment Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig interview oil expert, Gail Tverberg about the current market conditions with oil and other commodities.  If you're wanting to understand why the oil market might be heading lower, Gail provides some interesting arguments why low interest rates and government manipulation is causing major issues.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 088 : The Intelligent Investor (Investment Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig talk about Warren Buffett's favorite book, The Intelligent Investor.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 087 : Attending the Berkshire Hathaway Shareholder's Meeting (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig play the 5 best questions that were discussed during the Berkshire Hathaway Shareholder's Meeting.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 086 : Part II - Jack Schwager & Stock Market Wizards (Investment Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, you'll learn:   Why you should always decide what your exit criteria is for a security before you get in How to use fundamentals in trading How to optimally measure the performance of your portfolio Why traders in particular might want to use daily data to evaluate their strategy

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 085 : Jack Schwager & Stock Market Wizards (Money Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig interview legendary investment author, Jack Schwager. Jack has written books about the best investors on the planet, and in this interview with us, he shares some of the most interesting people he has met.  Jack talks about the most impressive investors and the scariest approaches he has written about. (remember, all the approaches resulted in fantastic results for the people implementing it)

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 084 : Billionaire Ted Turner's Story (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary:
In this episode, Preston and Stig read a book by Ted Turner
titled "Call Me Ted".  The book discusses the life and
business adventures of the author.  It provide a glimpse into
the decisions and thought process of growing a billion dollar
empire.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 083 : The First Billion is the Hardest by T Boone Pickens (Money Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig discuss T Boone Pickens' book, "The First Billion is the hardest".  Pickens is a oil Tycoon from Texas and his book outlines his life of business decisions and capital management.  At the end of the show, The Investors answer three questions from the members of their audience.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 082 : Jim Rickards - The New Case for Gold (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, Preston & Stig have their second part interview with renown economist, Jim Rickards.  In this episode, Jim talks about his book, The New Case for Gold.  Jim shares his conversation with Ben Bernanke, what types of environments gold performs well, and when people need to be on the look-out for a down-turn in the economy.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 081: Jim Rickards - China, Banking, & The New Case for Gold  (Part 1 of 2)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig interview world renown economist Jim Rickards about his new book,  The New Case for Gold.  In the interview, Jim talks about people that have influenced his way of thinking, how global currencies work, the Chinese Yuan, the Japanese economy and many other topics.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 080 : The Speed of Trust by Stephen Covey (Leadership Podcast)
episodes.summary: Although everyone knows trust is important to the success of any organization, Stephen Covey takes the idea to a much deeper level.  In Covey's book, The Speed of Trust, you'll learn how trust is an economic issue that revolves around the speed at which people and organizations operate.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 079 : The Effective Executive - by Peter Drucker (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: One of the key leadership books that billionaire Jeff Bezos recommends for all his employees is Peter Drucker's, The Effective Executive.  In this episode Preston and Stig talk about the leadership lessons they learned from reading this book.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 078 : Billionaire Moves in the Market & Negative Interest Rates (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, the investors talk to author of the "Modern Monetary System" - investing expect Cullen Roche.  Cullen talks about some of the different investments that billionaires are making in the current market conditions.  Additionally, he has a discussion about negative interest rates and how the banking system fundamentally works.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 077 : Billionaire Oprah Winfrey - What I Know for Sure (Investment Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, Preston and Stig read a book from Billionaire Oprah Winfrey.  Although this episode isn't the typical accounting and financial talk, the information discussed might be some of the most important information a person needs to be successful in life.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 076 : Mastermind Discussion 1Q 2016 (Investment Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, The Investor's Podcast mastermind group discusses a wide array of topics from oil, currencies, Japan, Warren Buffett's Shareholder Letters, and much more.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 075 : The Davos World Economic Forum and The One Thing by Gary Keller (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig discuss the topics covered at the Davos World Economic Forum.  Additionally, the investors discuss the book, The One Thing by Gary Keller.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 074 : Billionaire George Soros - The Alchemy of Finance (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig review George Soro's book, The Alchemy of Finance.  Additionally, The Investors discuss three questions from the audience at the end of the show.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 073 : Billionaire Howard Marks - The Most Important Thing (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig review billionaire Howard Marks' book, The Most Important Thing.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 072 : Creating a $10 Million Dollar Company by Age 24 - w/ Nathan Latka (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig interview multimillionaire Nathan Latka about creating your own assets.  Nathan created a $10 million dollar company by the age of 24.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 071 : Value Investing Questions from the Audience and Benjamin Franklin by Walter Isaacson
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig take value investing questions from the audience.  You won't want to miss their discussion on intrinsic value and many other numerous topics.  Additionally, the investors review Walter Isaacson's book, Benjamin Franklin.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 070 : Global Value Investing and Clone Investing w/ Meb Faber (Money Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig interview global value investor, Meb Faber.  Meb discussess the methods for investing internationally and also on how to conduct a clone investing approach to other famous investor's stock picks.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 069 : How to Win Friends and Influence People (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig talk about one of Warren Buffett's Favorite Books, How to Win Friends and Influence People by Dale Carnegie.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 068 : Current Market Conditions and Michael Lewis' Boomerang
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig talk about billionaire George Soros' prediction that the current market conditions resemble that of 2008.  Additionally, the Investors talk about Michael Lewis' book Boomerang.  http://www.theinvestorspodcast.com/episodes/68-current-market-conditions-michael-lewis-liars-boomerang.html

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 067 : Liar's Poker by Michael Lewis (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig discuss the New York Times best selling book, Liar's Poker by Michael Lewis.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 066 : Mastermind Discussion 4Q 2015 (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, the mastermind group discusses new and trending topics.  Those topics include: investing in technology during the 4Q 2015, momentum investing combined with value investing, taking short positions in junk bonds, the Japanese currencies.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 065 : Yale Professor, Robert Shiller's Book, Irrational Exuberance (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig discuss the key points from the book, Irrational Exuberance by Robert Shiller.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 064 : Warren Buffett's Biography (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig discuss the key aspects of the book, Buffett: The Making of an American Capitalist by Roger Lowenstein.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 063 : Quant Investing with Patrick O'Shaughnessy (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, The Investors talk to quant investing expert Patrick O'Shaughnessy. Patrick talks about his experiences in statistical backtesting and modeling of the stock market.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 062 : Warren Buffett's Favorite Book, Security Analysis (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig discuss their notes on Warren Buffett's Favorite Book, Security Analysis.  This book was written in the 1930's and it's an enormous text.  Many people in finance refer to the book as the bible of Value Investing.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 061 : Billionaire Charlie Munger with Tren Griffin (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, the Investors talk to Tren Griffin about his new book on Charlie Munger.  Munger is Warren Buffett's Vice Chairman at Berkshire Hathaway and one of the most influencial people in shaping Buffett's investment approach.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 060 : Pragmatic Capitalism with Cullen Roche (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, The Investors talk to money manager Cullen Roche about the modern monetary system.  Cullen was one of the few financial thinkers that predicted the deflationary forces that would occur from the FED's quantitative easing, so we talk to him about his model and how he arrived at his conclusion.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 059 : The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig talk about the best selling book, The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People by Stephen Covey.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 058 : Coined - The Essence of Money and How It Works with Kabir Sehgal (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig interview Kabir Sehgal about his New York Times best selling book, Coined.  The book provides a rich story of money and how its history has shaped us.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 057 : What Works On Wall Street with James O'Shaughnessy (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, the Investors talk to legendary investor, James O'Shaughnessy about his book, What Works on Wall Street.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 056 : Oil, Commodities, & Japan (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, The Investors discuss the ever changing commodities market and potential impact that China might have on Japan's economy.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 055 : Creating Assets and a Following (Marketing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, media expert, Dori Clark, talks about how people can create online assets and develop a following around their content.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 054 : Mastermind Discussion 3Q 2015 (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, the mastermind group discusses new information about Mohnish Pabrai's Dhandho Holding Company, the Japanese Stock Market, Currency Concerns, Quantitative Easing, Warren Buffett's recent stock market purchases, and much more.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 053 : Thinking, Fast and Slow | Quantitative Easing (Business Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, Preston and Stig start the show by talking about the current market conditions.  They focus their discussion on the quantitative easing that's happening in Europe and Japan.  After the initial discussion about the stock market, the Investor's discuss the newest book they read, Thinking Fast and Slow.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 052 : Billionaire Elon Musk - Tesla and SpaceX (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, Preston and Stig discuss Ashlee Vance's book about Elon Musk.  If you want to learn more about one of Sillicon Valley's most unique investor/inventor, you won't want to miss this episode.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 051 : Billionaire Mark Cuban's Book - How to Win at the Sport of Business (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, we talk about billioniare Mark Cuban's book and how he acquired his wealth.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 050 : Current Market Conditions and Billionaire Chris Sacca's Favorite Book (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, Preston and Stig talk about the crazy volatility in the financial market at the end of August 2015.  Additionally, The Investors read billionaire Chris Sacca's favorite book, The Magic of Thinking Big.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 049 : Quantitative Value Investing (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, we continue our discussion with Dr. Wesley Gray.  This time around, Dr. Gray talks about Quantitative Value Investing and how individuals can take advantage of mean reversion.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 048 : Investing in ETFs with Dr. Wesley Gray (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: This episode is an advanced look at how Exchange Traded Funds, or ETFs, work.  We talk with fund manager, Dr. Wesley Gray, about some of the unknown secrets in the finance industry.  In addition to the ETF discussion, Stig and Preston talk to Wes about the current market conditions.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 047 : The Black Swan (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: Billionaire Jeff Bezos and many other tech mogals have heavily endorsed the book, The Black Swan.  As a result, we read the book and recorded our discussion of the key points.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 046 : The Innovator's Dilemma (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we talk about billionaire Jeff Bezos, Mark Cuban, and Michael Bloomberg's favorite book, The Innovator's Dilemma.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 045 : Leadership You Can Invest In (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we interview leadership expert, Mike Figliuolo. Mike talks about the ways that leaders can optimize the performance of their subordinates.  Additionally, he discusses the key variables of what to look for when investing in a business.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 044 : Oil 101 - w/ Morgan Downey (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we talk to the Best Selling author, Morgan Downey, of the book Oil 101.  You won't want to miss his episode if you have an interest in the recent downturn in the oil market.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: In-B-Tween : Intrinsic Value and Bond Market Pressures (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: This In-B-Tween episode covers Warren Buffett's intrinsic value and current conditions in the bond market.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 043 : Mastermind Discussion 2Q 2015 (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, the panel discusses the impact of oil, current market conditions, and top performing Billionaires and their investing approach.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: In-B-Tween : Brands and Competitive Advantages (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: This In-B-Tween-isode covers the importance of competitive advantages.  The specific competitive advantage we discuss is the power of a brand.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 042 : Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Shareholder Letters (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we discuss the key highlights of Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway shareholder letters. Preston and Stig discuss look-through earnings, intrinsic value, and the overall business structure.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: In-B-Tween : Warren Buffett and Bill Gates on Heroes (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode, we research Warren Buffett and Bill Gates' opinions about heroes.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 041 : The 7 Biggest Mistakes Investors Make (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we interview West Point economics instructor, Brian Retherford, about the 7 biggest mistakes new investors make in the stock market.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 040 : Richard Branson - Screw it, Let's Do It (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we talk about what we learned from reading Billionaire Richard Branson's book, Screw it, Let's Do it.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: In-B-Tween : The 3 C's of Leadership (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this 5 minute episode, Preston lay's out the 3 C's of leadership that he learned at the 101st Airborne Division.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 039 : The Great Minds of Investing Part II (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In the second part interview with William Green, we discuss the investing approach of Mohnish Pabrai and Joel Greenblatt.  The discussion centers around the fundamentals and differences that the great minds of investing share.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 038 : The Great Minds of Investing - Part I (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, William Green talks to us about his new book, The Great Minds of Investing.  In this Interview we discuss Warren Buffett, Benjamin Graham, Charlie Munger, and many other investment gurus.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 037 : Billionaire Ray Dalio and other Market Wizards (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we discuss the book Hedge Fund Wizards by Jack Schwagger.  In the episode, we focus on the ideas of Ray Dalio, Edward Thorp, and Joel Greenblatt in order to discuss the approaches we liked the best.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 036 : Starting His Own Stock Exchange - with Jos Schmitt (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we have an engaging discussion with Jos Schmitt about his adventures in starting his own stock exchange.  The purpose of his new exchange was to combat the impact of High Frequency Trading on the Canadian Market.  If you ever wanted to hear about the inside story of starting your own stock exchange, you won't want to miss this interview.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 035 : How Currencies Work (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we discuss current events by Warren Buffett, Bill Gates, and Janet Yellen.  Additionally, we discuss the ideas contained in economist Jim Rickard's book, Currency Wars.  The discussion is helpful for people trying to understand how currencies interact with public debt, gold, and global commodities.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 034 : Real Estate Investing with BiggerPockets' Joshua Dorkin (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, Joshua Dorkin talks about his experience in the Real Estate market and how to conduct wise investment choices.  Josh runs the very popular Bigger Pockets Real Estate community.  The group discusses risks in long term interest rates and fun ideas like house flipping.  You won't want to miss this interesting conversation on how real estate investing is done the right way.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 033 : Shorting the Japanese Debt and Currency (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast we talk to professional trader and hedge fund manager, Tres Knippa.  Tres talks about his unique positions in shorting the Japanese debt and currency markets.  Tres believes the Japanese currency is destined for failure based on the government's inability to sell newly issued bonds to anyone other than themselves.  The interview is very interesting and it's sure to give you some interesting ideas for the next stock market crash.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 032 : The Balance Sheet Recession and Quantitative Easing Trap (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, Preston and Stig discuss the newest book they read titled: The Escape from Balance Sheet Recession and Quantitative Easing Trap.  The book was written by the economist Richard Koo and he talks about the comparison between Japan in the 1990's and the World Ecomony today.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 031 : My Interview with Warren Buffett and other Billionaires - with Gillian Zoe Segal (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this interview, author Gillian Zoe Segal, talks about her interviews with Warren Buffett and many other Billionaires.  In Gillian's new book, Getting There, she interviews 30 people that have become enormous sucesses.  Stig and Preston ask Gillian how she got the interviews and the best pieces of advice she was provided by her subjects.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 030 : What in the World is Bitcoin? (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode the Investors talk about the disruptive new digital currency technology that's growing around the world.  Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies could eventual become a popular form of payment without limits across international boarders.  This is a fascinating discussion that you won't want to miss.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 029 : What is the Federal Reserve doing? (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we explore the history and impact of the Federal Reserve.  As you will see, the Federal Reserve has the biggest impact on the growth and contraction of any other variable.  We discuss that variable, the money multiplier, in this episode.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 028 : Think and Grow Rich - Napoleon Hill (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this week's episode of The Investor's Podcast, we learn about one of the most foundational books ever written on success: Think and Grow Rich, by Napoleon Hill.  This book has an interesting premise - the things you think about most will materialize into your life if you have faith and reason.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 027 : Value Investing Traps (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, Andrew Sather talks about the dangers of value traps when conducting value investing.  This is an important episode for many of the investors that try to impliment Benjamin Graham or Warren Buffett style investing.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 026 : Billionaire Mark Cuban's Book Recommendation - Rework (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we discuss the key points from the book, Rework.  The billionaire Mark Cuban said that if given a choice between a person with an MBA or a person who read the book, Rework, he would pick Rework every time.  At the end of the show, The Investors discuss the comments by billionaire Ray Dalio and famous Harvard professor, Larry Summers.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 025 : Deep Value Investing - w/ Tobias Carlisle (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investors Podcast, we interview the author of the book, Deep Value.  This book is a fascinating read that statistically demonstrates the theory that companies with very bad past performance (with respect to earnings), tend to outperform high premium picks.  The book was highly influenced by Benjamin Graham and Joel Greenblatt and it comes highly recommended by Preston and Stig.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 024 : How to Be an Outlier - Malcolm Gladwell's book (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we review Malcolm Gladwell's famous book, Outliers.  We discuss the key ingrediants for what it takes to become an outlier and what people should be thinking about if they really want to become an enormous success like Bill Gates or the Beatles.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 023 : Stock Market Bubbles and Asset Allocation (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: At the beginning of 2015, the Stock Market is at an all time high.  As a result, The Investor's ask MorningStar's expert, Paul Arnold, about the proper asset allocation during these periods of high valuations.  If you have a lot of money in the stock market, you might want to listen closely to this weeks episode.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 022 : Influence - The Psychology of Persuasion - Robert Cialdini's Book (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: The Billionaire Charlie Munger has said that the book, Influence by Robert Cialdini is his favorite book of all time.  In this episode we talk about the top level ideas found in Cialdini's book and relate some of the concepts back to stock investing.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 021 : How to Invest in Real Estate (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: Have you every wanted to buy commercial real estate, but you didn't know how to get into the game?  In this episode, we harness the decades of experience from our mystery guest and learn how he built a real estate portfolio with over 100 units. You'll learn how real estate is valued and the general principals to good management.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 020 : How to Create Passive Income - with Pat Flynn (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: Pat Flynn is an internet superstar that has created a multimillion dollar enterprise around online business. In this episode, Pat shares some of his secrets for creating new assets.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 019 : How High Frequency Trading Works - Michael Lewis Book (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: Finance can be a very dry subject, but this episode is surely going to debunk that opinion.  High Frequency Trading is a fascinating story of how a few elite technologists have outsmarted big Wall Street banks in making Billions of dollars through 1 cent increments.  The problem is the common investor is the one paying the bill.  You won't want to miss this exciting and ever changing story.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 018 : Tony Robbins' Book - Money, Master the Game (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, Preston and Stig talk about what they learned in Tony Robbins' book, Money: Master the Game.  During their discussion, they talk about the myths of investing and they also talk about the advice of a few billionaires.  This was a fun and interesting episode that you won't want to miss.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 017 : My Business Deal with Billionaire Mark Cuban (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: Have you ever wondered what it would be like to go on the hit TV show, Shark Tank?  In our interview with Stephan Aarstol, we ask him insider questions and also what it's like to be a business owner with billionaire Mark Cuban.  The episode generated some good discussion about search engine optimization (SEO) and running an online business.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 016 : ETFs or Mutual Funds? We ask MorningStar Expert (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: Are you getting ripped-off by owning a mutual fund? We think so, but let's here what MorningStar expert, Alex Bryan has to say.  Learn what other options you have for protecting your principal and growing your money.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 015 : Guy Spier (Part II) - The Education of a Value Investor (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this second part interview with Guy Spier, The Investor's continue their discussion with the author of, The Education of a Value Investor.  This episode discusses intrinsic value, Guy's checklist, and how to protect your capital during adverse conditions.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 014 : Guy Spier - The Education of a Value Investor (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we have the renown Guy Spier on the show to talk about his new book, The Education of a Value Investor.  in 2008, Guy and Mohnish Pabrai bid $650,000 to have lunch with Warren Buffett.  In our interview, you'll quickly learn there's a lot more to guy than investing and expensive lunches.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 013 : How Billionaire's Larry Page and Sergey Brin Built Google (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we have a discussion about Google and the book, In The Plex.  If you ever wanted to know more about the Google founders, Larry Page and Serga Brin, or how Google makes money, you'll definitely enjoy this episode.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 012 : Psychology and Stock Investing (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we have a discussion with the author of, The Emotionally Intelligent Investor, about psychology and Stock Investing.  If you're interested in learning about your conscious and unconscious decisions, this episode will definitely peek your interest.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 011 : Billionaire Jeff Bezos - The Secrets to his Success (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, Stig, Preston, and Hari, discuss Jeff Bezos's success with Amazon. The catalyst for the discussion is Brad Stone's Book, The Everything Store. Click here to download our executive summary of this book. Members who sign-up on our mailing list will recieve these free book outlines/summaries in the future.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 010 : Venture Capital Q&A (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, Stig and Preston have a question and answer period with Peter Gaudet - an owner of his own Investment Bank. The panel discusses venture capital and how to be successful as the founder of a company.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 009 : How Charles Koch amassed $43 Billion Dollars (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, Stig and Preston discover Charles Koch's secrets to financial success.  They base their opinions on Charles' book, The Science of Success.  This episode is packed with valuable information, so you'll definitely want to check-out their show notes.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 008 : Value Investing - Questions from a Newbie (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, the panel is asked important questions from a new value investor that's interested in putting money into the stock market.  If you're looking to do the same, or you're interested in hearing some fantastic questions, you won't want to miss this week's episode.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 007 : Peter Thiel's book - Zero to One (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, the panel discusses the ideas of Peter Thiel.  Peter is a famous Silicon Valley Billionaire who founded PayPal and Palantir.  He also owned a 10% stake in Facebook.  The Investors, along with Hari Ramachandra, discuss Peter's new book - Zero to One.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 006 : The Next Stock Market Crash & Interest Rates (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, the panel discusses the impact of interest rates on Stock Market Crashes.  The Investors are joined by Rob Mercuri, who's a Vice President of Risk management from a top-ten consumer bank in America.  You won't want to miss this episode if you want to know how top executives view the market as a whole and how to take advantage of potential opportunities.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 005 : Working on the Floor of the NY Stock Exchange (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, we have a fun and casual conversation with Gregg Pisani - a former trader on the floor of the NY Stock Exchange. Gregg discusses the typical work day and what it's like processing millions of trades each day. If you've ever wondered what all those people are doing on the floor of the NY Stock Exchange, you'll probably enjoy listening to some of Gregg's funny experiences.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 004 : Mohnish Pabrai and Dhandho Holdings (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this episode of The Investor's Podcast, Hari Ramachandra discusses his investment in the Pabrai Funds, managed by the emerging, and newly famous, Mohnish Pabrai.  Pabrai has adopted the same principals as Warren Buffett, and Hari discusses the similarities and differences during the episode.  Hari also discusses his experience of attending Pabrai's shareholders meeting.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 003 : Warren Buffett's 4 Rules to Stock Investing (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: Have you ever wondered what rules Warren Buffett might use to analyze potential stock picks. In episode three, the Investors discuss Buffett's 4 rules to selecting a successful stock pick. You won't want to miss this important discussion!

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 002 : Warren Buffett Investing Basics part 2 (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this session of The Investor's Podcast, we discuss the two methods of receiving earnings and Benjamin Graham's Mr. Market example.

episodes.seriesTitle: We Study Billionaires - The Investors Podcast
episodes.title: TIP 001 : Warren Buffett Investing Basics  (Investing Podcast)
episodes.summary: In this session of The Investor's Podcast, we discuss the fundamental elements of Warren Buffett's investing approach in the stock market.
